CONTINUIDAD DE UNA FUNCIÃ“N - Ejercicio 2

[imath] f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}{3 x^{2}-1} & {\text { si } x \leq-1} \\ {2 a x+3 b} & {\text { si }-1<x<2} \\ {4 x+7} & {\text { si } x \geq 2}\end{array}\right. [/imath]\nHallar [imath] a [/imath] y [imath] b [/imath] para que [imath] f [/imath] sea continua en [imath] \mathbb{R} [/imath][imath]{3 x^{2}-1} & {\text { si } x \leq-1} [/imath] [imath] {2 a x+3 b} & {\text { si }-1<x<2} [/imath] [imath] {4 x+7} & {\text { si } x \geq 2}[/imath]
